data.title: BBC Radio 1 returns to Ibiza this August
data.meta_description: BBC Radio 1 to return to Ibiza this August for a weekend of dance music: Line up includes Annie Mac, Zane Lowe Sasha and Pete Tong.
data.text:
BBC Radio 1 will return to Ibiza this August for its annual weekend of live broadcasts and events on the island - packed full of the best new music and hottest DJ sets.

The three day event will run from Friday 1st August to Sunday 3rd August with Radio 1 DJs Nick Grimshaw, Zane Lowe, Annie Mac, Pete Tong, Danny Howard, MistaJam, B. Traits and Toddla T all confirmed..

The weekend will kick off on Friday 1st August with a free party at the Ushuaia Beach Hotel in Playa d'en Bossa.

Information on ticketing for Radio 1's free party at Ushuaia will be announced in July when the star line-up will also be revealed, so keep listening to Radio 1 for details.

On Saturday 2nd August, Radio 1 will return to Cream @ Privilege for an exclusive event. The special live extended five-hour Essential Mix will begin at midnight and will feature sets from Steve Angello and Above & Beyond, with Sasha and Pete Tong performing back to back.

The bumper line-up also includes Radio 1's Annie Mac, Zane Lowe, MistaJam, Friction, Toddla T and B.Traits featuring MC Juma, as well as Oliver $, Huxley, Wilkinson, Second City, T.Williams, plus a special guest still to be announced.

Pete Tong said: "Radio 1 in Ibiza is an annual tradition and the biggest event of the summer. The free party at Ushuaia will be a phenomenal start to the weekend, and going back to back with Sasha during the Essential Mix at Privilege will be a big moment."

Nick Grimshaw will kick off proceedings, broadcasting The Radio 1 Breakfast Show from the White Isle on Friday 1st August.

Annie Mac will round off Radio 1 in Ibiza on Sunday 3rd August, broadcasting a Sunday evening show from the island.

Listeners back home in the UK can tune in or log on to enjoy coverage of Radio 1 in Ibiza via the live Radio 1 shows and online at the Radio 1 website.

You can also listen on the go through the mobile and BBC iPlayer Radio apps. Radio 1's free party at Ushuaia will also be live streamed in vision at BBC.co.uk/radio1 and there will be highlights of the weekend on Radio 1's YouTube channel.
